questions.question: You don’t work on Sundays, .....................?
questions.description: We use affirmative question tags after negative verbs.

questions.question: They haven’t forgotten us, ..................... .?
questions.description: We use affirmative question tags after negative verbs.

questions.question: There is little point in doing anything about it, .......................?
questions.description: Words like hardly and little are negative, so we use an affirmative tag after them.

questions.question: You passed the test, ..................... ..?
questions.description: When the sentence is in the simple past tense, we make question tags with did or didn't.

questions.question: They bought a new car last week, .....................?
She wants to be a writer, .......................?
questions.description: When the sentence is in the simple present tense, we make question tags with do or does.

questions.question: They make a lot of money, …..................... ..?
No one helped him, .......................?
questions.description: Words like no and none are negative, so we use an affirmative tag after them.
